website_summaries.verdict: It's pricey, but the curvature of this hammer handle is not commonly found with replacements.
pros: Handle measures 18 inches in length, so you'll be looking to add this handle to a big hammer head
Ships with both metal and wood wedges, allowing you to pick the material that will work best with your needs
Curvature of this handle will help you maintain a steady grip on the hammer
cons: Longevity of this hammer handle is questionable, which is disappointing at this price point

customer_reviews.title: Engineered to wobble
customer_reviews.text: The top of the handle where it passes through the eye of the hammer is tapered way too much. The only reason for doing that would be for mass production. A properly hung hammer should have almost the entire surface area of the wood inside the eye in contact with metal, not just a little at the top and bottom. It takes careful hand work to make that happen. The grain orientation was about 45 degrees on my handle which isn't great. If you mention stiletto on any job site you will hear many stories of heads flying off handles, it's because they make terrible handles.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it!  It’s garbage compared to original!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hammer I’ve ever owned! After 20 yrs of construction I needed a hammer that was lighter but still swings with force. The original handle lasted me almost 2 years. I babied it at first but then abused it like a regular hammer after the first month or so. I broke the replacement on day 1 I just broke my second replacement 2 wks later. I will not be purchasing another Would rather order a new stiletto and it would be cheaper!!! The original handle was made of stronger wood!
customer_reviews.author: ryan peyton

customer_reviews.title: I’m disappointed as I have not experienced this short of a ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this replacement handle for my framing hammer in October after I broke the handle (the factory handle lasted about 2 yrs). This handle lasted me about six months before it also broke. I’m disappointed as I have not experienced this short of a lifespan with other framing hammers. Currently I am waffling between giving Stiletto one more try or just letting it go. I gave this two stars as the handle has a good feel when driving nails (though most nails are shot in these days)
customer_reviews.author: Casa Dei Re

customer_reviews.title: Twisted, curved, terrible!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this replacement handle for my Stiletto hammer. I expected a quality handle if it is made and stamped by Stiletto... it was not. The handle has a huge curve in it and it didnt fit the head of the hammer. It's to small... atleast make it to big so I can shape it down to fit. I kept it only because I use a hammer everyday for work and needed it the next day. Otherwise it would have been returned. Anyone looking to buy this handle you have been WARNED.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I,ve had my stilleto titanium hammer head and handle for a long time now
customer_reviews.text: I,ve had my stilleto titanium hammer head and handle for a long time now , possibly ten years and handle finally broke when I tried to pull a rusted nail straight out while in a hurry I could not find a new handle even similar then came across my old Amazon purchases page today and will be ordering new handle . When you install new handle use some liquid nail around shaft and use extra steel shims to spread wood more . I use a combo of straight steel shims and a circular steel shim
customer_reviews.author: Solar Fabric

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last as long as it should
customer_reviews.text: I'm buying this for a 3rd time now as the 2 other replacement handles lasted less than 6 months each time. It's cheaper to purchase replacement handles than to purchase a whole new hammer each time...Still love the feel and weight to Stiletto and will keep doing so but wish they'd up their quality game a little...
customer_reviews.author: eat2006

customer_reviews.title: Great hammer, weak handles.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT USE YOUR WOODEN HANDLED STILETTO HAMMER TO PULL NAILS! My third handle. Love the hammer, but the design of the handle makes it really narrow at the point where it enters the head of the hammer and you can shear it right off with a good pull. I will be more careful and I will keep using my Stiletto. Someday I might have to look into an all metal hammer, but not today, I'm still too dedicated to the one I have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shameful quality and craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: Would give 0 stars if possible. Terrible grain orientation. Mass made product with no regard of quality or craftsmanship. Shameful
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: NOT A HATCHET HANDLE
customer_reviews.text: This is a framing hammer handle. It will not fit a hatchet or small axe. The handle is made backward from any axe eye I've ever seen and it's too small for even a very small hatchet. I had to cut mine off and remake the shoulder to fit a hatchet head.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Not correct
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice handle with the grain structure going the right direction. I purchased this for an antique hatchet and it will not work as the tear drop on the end is facing the wrong direction and is too small.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Smith

customer_reviews.title: Thanks
customer_reviews.text: Thanks for the quick delivery, and as always a great product. The price is right as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Trusler

customer_reviews.title: Get it
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what you need if you broke you wooden handled stilletto hammer handle
customer_reviews.author: dustin cooper

customer_reviews.title: like a hunk of metal on a stick
customer_reviews.text: I think I'm in double digits with replacement handles original purchase 1998 .....before then It was a crafftsman 28 ounce framing hammer, like a hunk of metal on a stick ,,,,,,,,,,stiletto hammer ,,,,, Love the hammer and wood handles well they don't last but that's the trade off
customer_reviews.author: Dog

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give it a half a star. The wood was cut wrong so the grain is weak. Had my old Stellato that came factory with a fatter handle and used it for years. But this replacement handle and it lasted me one week. I love stiletto products but this cheapening of the wooden handle is very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Just okay for a little while
customer_reviews.text: I guess it’s okay. My husband just ended up buying a new hammer eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Very nice replacement. The bag where the wood wedge and ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice replacement. The bag where the wood wedge and 2 round steel wedges and directions are in had a hole, the hole seemed perfect like someone pushed a finger through and took 1 round steel wedge out. So now I’m one steel wedge short. I’ve bought many stiletto handles from amazon with no issues but this issue got past up. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: I must have received a weak handle, so sooner ...
customer_reviews.text: I must have received a weak handle, so sooner did i replace my old handle did the new one break. I guess i have to buy another one...
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Just fine for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I needed a wooden handle for a small axe head. This fit the bill for what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Roberts Aultman

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: same as original handle i had on my stiletto. great handle
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Replacement handle
customer_reviews.text: Handle is as described. Fits my 14 oz. Stiletto hammer head. Comes with wooden and metal wedges and installation instructions. Knocking the old broken handle stub out is difficult but installation of new handle was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Murray

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly into my Stiletto titanium head. Price was good to.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement handle! Little larger than the original but I got used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement handle!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly and comes with the factory style wedges! Easy to setup!!
customer_reviews.author: John P. Sprouse Jr.

customer_reviews.title: 2 in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 2 stars just because it fits. But they're very weak handles. Framing houses I have gone through 2 in 2 months
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: His Stiletto is his favorite handle and had been repaired many times with nails ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for my dad. His Stiletto is his favorite handle and had been repaired many times with nails and soaking it in water - it was definitely time for a new handle. This one is working great and he's happy again!
customer_reviews.author: Julie B-L

customer_reviews.title: I cant believe they are selling these
customer_reviews.text: Absolute waste of money. The handle wasnt thick enough to fill the head of my hammer. As I pounded in the steel shims the handle cracked because there was too much extra space. Very unhappy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: My handle broke on the second day I used it. Maybe I got a defective one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and made my favorite tool like new again in minutes
customer_reviews.text: Handle came just as I expected. Went on with ease, and made my favorite tool like new again in minutes. Stiletto hammers rock!
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Howald

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss...
customer_reviews.text: As other reviews have said, check the grain direction. Mine was going the wrong direction. I will be sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Marc P.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This handle was exactly what I was looking for. I purchased 2 handles and both were the thinnner versions that I was looking for. Will be buying backups
customer_reviews.author: Klayton

customer_reviews.title: As good as the original and easy to put on.
customer_reviews.text: A new hammer in over $125 and this was a fraction of the cost in comparison. Took less than 5 min. to fix put the old head on this handle. I know I will break the handle again because I use it to pry too much, but I don't want to give up my titanium head.
customer_reviews.author: Terri L Hinton

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it works great.Well built.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived very fast, extremely sturdy and heavy. Does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great but not durable
customer_reviews.text: Worked as it should. Install wasnt to difficult. The best hammer ive used. But the handles wont last that long under heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: collin letz

customer_reviews.title: Worked just perfect. Saved me $80 - cost of a new ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked just perfect. Saved me $80 - cost of a new framer.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Just what was ordered
customer_reviews.text: Unhappy with the history of these handles breaking - but the replacement handle was a perfect fit. We bought this handle to replace the one that broke after removing just a few nails. Don't use it for nail removal!
customer_reviews.author: WW

customer_reviews.title: Replacment went very well!
customer_reviews.text: Even though the framing hammer previously had an 18-inch handle, wish I'd gotten a 16-inch handle. Still replacement went very well.
customer_reviews.author: Reno Ken

customer_reviews.title: Replacement hammer handle
customer_reviews.text: The hammer is my husband's and he says the replacement is awesome. He said when the hammer was new the head was never very tight but with the replacement it's better than ever.
customer_reviews.author: Judy K. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: 3 stars
customer_reviews.text: If you get an stilleto hammer with hickory handle make sure you get at least 2 extra handles because they are going to break sooner than you expect. Other than that it is a great hammer and will help you get the job done without much effort.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Just like the handle that was on my hammer when I bought it
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Steletto hammer handle
customer_reviews.text: This curved handle gives you power and excellent control it's very strong sapwood hickory can use it all day without fatigue ..
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Barely had it for 2 weeks and the handle already ...
customer_reviews.text: Barely had it for 2 weeks and the handle already cracked. Biggest problem with ordering it online is not seeing the grains before buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Fullmer

customer_reviews.title: pefect
customer_reviews.text: This handle fit perfectly on my stilletto head. Now I can get that broken hammer from the bottom of my toolbox and back into my sidearms.
customer_reviews.author: Gigantor

customer_reviews.title: heads up
customer_reviews.text: Fit like a glove. Used to be able to buy replacement handles at Home Depot but they no longer carry them. This was a perfect match. Someone had broken the handle and just threw away the whole thing. I hate to see things go to waste so I fished it out of the dumpster and now have another hammer to add to my collection. I might not have life insurance or a 401K but I got me some hammers.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Robert W. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: i still love this hammer -
customer_reviews.text: split the last one right down the middle and almost broke a window with the flying parts.... i still love this hammer - Thor
customer_reviews.author: Not my real name

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: still using it for over a year and i work construction

customer_reviews.title: I buy one every year
customer_reviews.text: Makes my hammer new again. Every time. Handle dry out or become cracked with use, especially in remodeling, so instead of buying new hammers, I buy new handles.

customer_reviews.text: Broke the first day my husband used It on the job.

customer_reviews.title: Broke the first time I tried to pry a nail ...
customer_reviews.text: Broke the first time I tried to pry a nail out. Thus is the second handle that has broke 90 my $70+ hammer. Absolutely ridiculous.

customer_reviews.title: One Star

customer_reviews.text: Took a while to get here about 3 weeks, but it was a perfect fit.

customer_reviews.title: The best handle
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Excellent ergonomics, will reduce carpenters elbow symptoms greatly! This is all I use, I build every day for my living.

customer_reviews.text: The item delivered is exactly what the description said it was. Very satisfied. Thanks

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Great product, lousy ship time
customer_reviews.text: Stiletto hammers are great products, but not indestructible ( wood handles ). This may be my third handle in 10 + years. My 15 ounce titanium hammer started out as a waffle face, but has long since been worn down to a smooth face. Just don't but from gatzies here on amazon. Two weeks of ship time is rediculous, when you are used to prime two day.
customer_reviews.author: tim fritsch

customer_reviews.title: Good end to a bad day.
customer_reviews.text: I am a contractor, and you can imagine my dismay, when I came to NM from Oregon to do a job and my Stiletto hammer broke :( Not to worry - Amazon got me a new handle in less than a week! Back up and running now. This hammer in the photos has been used for 5 years professionally.

customer_reviews.title: replacement handle
customer_reviews.text: the handle fit good except I wish 1/2 in longer in the head.. I took care of that with some expoxy

customer_reviews.title: Nice item fast shipping good price
customer_reviews.text: Great hammer shaft replaced my old handle which was all chipped up

product_meta.title: Stiletto 18-Inch Curved Replacement Handle
product_meta.description: Includes 18-in Curved Hickory Replacement Handle (12, 14, 19, 21 oz.) - STLHDL-C, (2) Round Steel Wedges, Poplar Wood Wedge, Replacement Instructions.
feature_bullets: Select propellants that deliver consistent accuracy and performance
Product is manufactured in United States
